intro: Loxostigma hekouensis, commonly known as the Hekou spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
